abstracts.cdata!:
The objectives of the Second Higher
            Education Project for Nepal are: (a) to enhanced quality and
            relevance of higher education and research through a set of
            incentives for promoting effective management and financial
            sustainability of academic institutions; and (b) to improved
            access for academically qualified under-privileged students,
            including girls, Dalit's and educationally
            disadvantaged janajati to higher education through financial
            assistance and enhanced capacity of higher secondary
            schools. The changes are: the project closing date is to be
            extended from January 15, 2014 to June 30, 2014 aligning it
            with the International Development Association, or IDA
            fiscal year (and also closely with the government fiscal
            year). The extension is mainly to continue assistance to
            financially poor students on scholarships and for research
            scholars already supported by the project. The extension
            will also facilitate continuity and smooth transition to a
            new project under development. To facilitate the full and
            optimum utilization of project resources, a final
            reallocation of funds is proposed. The total reallocation is
            SDR 1.775 million amongst categories of expenditure: SDR 0.6
            million is to be reallocated to category 1A, 0.3 million
            from category 1C, and category 5 each. Similarly, SDR 1.175
            million is to be reallocated to category 2, SDR 1.00 million
            from category 1D, SDR 0.04 million from category 4, and SDR
            0.135 million from category 6.
